meanings.definition: A test administered before the actual test to assess a student's knowledge or skills.
meanings.sent1: Before the big exam, the teacher gave us a pretest to see what we already knew.
meanings.sent2: The pretest helped the teacher understand what topics we needed more help with.
meanings.sent3: During the pretest, the students were surprised by how much they already knew.
meanings.sent4: The pretest acted like a sneak peek into the upcoming test, preparing us for what was to come.
meanings.sent5: The pretest was like a practice round before the real challenge.

meanings.definition: To administer a test before the actual test to assess a student's knowledge or skills.
meanings.sent1: The teacher will pretest the students to gauge their understanding before the final exam.
meanings.sent2: It is important to pretest the participants to ensure the validity of the study results.
meanings.sent3: The students were pretested to make sure they were ready for the advanced course.
meanings.sent4: She decided to pretest the new software before implementing it across the company.
meanings.sent5: The doctor will pretest the patient to determine the best course of treatment.
